```{r}
library(ggplot2)
library(dplyr)
library(magrittr)
library(tidyverse)
library(scales)
```

```{r}
#Graph 1
caption <- paste(strwrap("Source: kaggle.com", 40),collapse="\n") #I am trying to add this as the source in the graph


ggplot(health, aes(State, rate2010, color = stateexpansion)) +
  geom_point() +
  xlab("State") +
  ylab("Uninsured Rate in 2010") +
  ggtitle("Percentage of Uninsured Population in 2010 by State") +
  annotate("text", label = caption, hjust = 0, vjust=1, size=4)
```

```{r}
#Graph 2
ggplot(health, aes(State, rate2015, shape = stateexpansion)) +
  geom_point() +
  xlab("State") +
  ylab("Uninsured Rate in 2015") +
  ggtitle("Percentage of Uninsured Population in 2015 by State") +
  annotate("text", label = caption, hjust = 0, vjust=1, size=4)
```

```{r}
#Graph 3

ggplot(health, aes(rate2010, rate2015, color = State)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_line() +
  xlab("Uninsured Rate in 2010") +
  ylab("Uninsured Rate in 2015") +
  ggtitle("Percentage of Uninsured Population - 2010 vs. 2015") +
  annotate("text", label = caption, hjust = 0, vjust=1, size=4)
```
```{r}
#Graph 4

ggplot(health, aes(State, employer2015)) +
  geom_line() +
  xlab("State") +
  ylab("State Expansion") +
  ggtitle("Whether the State Had Medicaid Expansion in 2016") +
  annotate("text", label = caption, hjust = 0, vjust=1, size=4)
```
